title: 3 Mirwaiz faction leaders join Geelani
content:
Comment  ·  print ·  T  T 

T+·  T- 

Hurriyat chairman Syed Ali Shah Geelani with three separatist leader who joined his group in Srinagar on Wednesday.– PHOTO: Nissar Ahmad 

The Hurriyat faction headed by Syed Ali Shah Geelani received a shot in the arm on Wednesday when three top separatists, previously with the Mirwaiz Umar Farooq faction, joined his group. 

Shabir Ahmad Shah of the Democratic Freedom Party (DFP), Nayeem Ahmad Khan of the National Front and Aga Hassan Budgami of Anjuman-e-Sharie Shian addressed a joint press conference at Mr. Geelani’s residence. 

“Whoever is sincere towards movement, our doors are open,” Mr. Geelani said. 

The three leaders were asked to sign “Meesaq-e-Hurriyat” (Covenant of Hurriyat), which enjoins upon members not to violate the Hurriyat’s 1993 constitution. 

“We renewed our pledge to abide by the constitution of 1993,” said one of the three leaders. 

The leaders left the Mirwaiz’s faction last year. Pertinently, Pakistan has been pushing for unity among the separatists for several years now. 

“The process will continue,” said Hurriyat’s Ayaz Akbar. 

Geelani’s Hurriyat has roped in 11 new constituents in recent months, taking the total number to 21.
